pr_title: Discard current card in deck picker

timeline.message: NF: regressino test for limit of new card after review

timeline.bodyText: I feel it'd be better to move this decision inside the method, dependent on a parameter, rather than depending on knowledge of the classes internals.
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
There is currently no decision to take at all. This is a remark that is potentially relevant only if one day we expect to be able to have both a deck picker and the reviewer shown simultaneously. And if you ever want to do that, there is no way you don't have to know the classes internal, because they both interact a lot with the scheduler in incompatible ways.
I don't believe there is any reason to offer the option in code, it would be uselessly confusing; if someone want to call this method somewhere else, they would need to find what the parameter means.
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText:
if someone want to call this method somewhere else, they would need to find what the parameter means.

That's exactly the point, a caller should be aware that the state of the method depends on whether there is a card in the scheduler and should be aware of their explicit decision to take it into account, or to ignore it.
replies.author: david-allison-1
